result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raekwon M Miller

defendant.name: Miller, Raekwon M
defendant.address: 1115 E. Wilson St. Apt. 414, Madison, WI 53703

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
ec: DA and Atty Luchsinger (10/7/22--ma)
Contnuance
for Continuance
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Cases 21CF270 and 22CF214 called at 3:39PM
Defendant Raekwon M Miller appeared by video.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger appeared by video. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Shock indicates that the State is in agreement with the examiner's finding that Mr. Miller is competent to proceed. Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the Defense agrees that Mr. Miller is competent to proceed. Attorney Luchsinger confirms that he has discussed the examiner's report with Mr. Miller, and that Mr. Miller believes that he is competent. The Court finds the Defendant is competent to proceed.
Noting that the file is at the Preliminary Hearing stage, Att Luchsinger requests that a Prelim be scheduled.

recess 3:43PM

NEXT: 
As to file 22CF214: Preliminary Hearing on 11/18 at 9:30AM (21CF270 to track along for Status)
ec: DA, Atty Luchsinger, DHS/MMHI (8/2/22--ma)
Order for Competency Examination by the Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on September 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Cases 21CF270 and 22CF214 called at 2:21 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Raekwon M Miller in court.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Raekwon M Miller. 
Court reviews case history, status and filings. 
Atty. Luchsinger requests additional time given the health issues of the defendant. 
Court and Counsel address procedural issues relating to the competency order and expiration. 
Court makes a new order for comp. examination with the same findings and orders as previously made on 6/22/2022. 
Atty. Luchsinger to submit proposed orders.
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Court orders that Atty. Luchsinger make an appointment with Dr. Schoenicker today. 
Case continued for Comp. Hrg. - 9/30/22 at 3pm.
At the request of a Deputy present in the courtroom, the Court verifies that the Warrant in 22CF214 was quashed. 
Recess 2:26pm.

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
Comp. Hrg. - 9/30/22 at 3pm.

[Post - hearing clerk's note - review of the files finding that the motion and order to quash warrant was only filed in 21CF270 however, it was verified that the intent of the Court at this time is that defendant not have a pending warrant in either pending case.]
Extradition Forecast
Returnable to Branch 3 only
Issue bench warrant for defendant - Branch 3 only, for Inpatient Exam
MILLER NO SHOW LTR

[ma] Cases 21CF270 & 22CF214 called at 8:55 AM 
Defendant Raekwon M Miller in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Luchsinger indicates that Mr. Miller and his mother are awaiting contact from doctor. 
The Court directs Defendant/Counsel to be proactive and contact the doctor/facility to coordinate examination. 

recess: 9:02am 
NEXT: Cases to remain calendared for 7/28/22 at 2:00pm
ec: DA, Atty Luchsinger, Def, DHS/MMHI(6/22/22--ma)
Order for Competency Examination by the Department of Health Services
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing on July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] cases #21CF270 and #22CF214 10:05 AM 
Defendant Raekwon M Miller appears by telephone. Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court quashes the Warrant-authorization in case #22CF214.
Attorney Luchsinger indicates he is raising competency as to case #22CF214 also. 
The Court finds probable cause in the case #21CF214 Criminal Complaint. The Court orders a competency evaluation in case #21CF214. 
Mr. Miller verifies his current phone number [clerk enters this number in the case demographics as the cellphone number]

During a discussion by the Court and counsel regarding the previously ordered competency examination [in case #21CF270] not being completed yet, ADA Shock requests that the Court order a warrant and an in-custody competency evaluation.  Instead the Court directs Attorney Luchsinger to submit the proposed orders today and then to assist Mr. Miller in communications to ensure that arrangements are made for the examination appointment and getting the examination completed. The Court schedules a hearing next Friday to check on this, indicating that if the examination is not scheduled or better yet completed by then, Mr. Miller will be taken into custody for in-custody examination
recess 10:13am 

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Luchsinger is to submit proposed Orders for Competency Examination as to both cases today,    (2) Status Conference on June 24th at 9:00am with in person appearances required. [JA-note in comments that if it is learned Mr. Miller does not have the examination appointment set up, the Court's intent is that Mr. Miller will be taken into custody for the examination]
Initial appearance on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ae] case called 11:04 AM Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds probable cause issues warrant body only but stays warrant until 6/16/22 at 10:00 am with defendants other case
recess: 11:07 am
NEXT: IA 6/16/22 at 10:00 am in Branch 3

On today's date, the filings in this case will indicate that Att Rumpf was appointed to this file. This is incorrect. Att Luchsinger was appointed to this file by the PD's Office. This mistake has been corrected in the filing - ML
Correct Attorney of Record
Att Luchsinger

Due to summons not being mailed timely the Court adjourns todays hearing
